job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Job Summary

Randstad is seeking a Software Engineer with experience in Aerospace or the Automotive industry to support the Embedded development of a state-of-the-art alternative fuel Aircraft Propulsion System. You will work with a diverse international team and head up the design and development of the Control Systems. Your work will truly revolutionize air transportation across North America and Europe.

location: Everett, Washington
job type: Permanent
salary: $135,000 - 145,000 per year
work hours: 8am to 4pm
education: Bachelors

Responsibilities
  • Select appropriate HW/SW platforms and architectures to achieve real-time data acquisition and control of complex systems including Propulsion system, power management, and safety features
  • Develop embedded code to perform system telemetry and control for these complex systems in real-time (< microseconds)
  • Develop assorted software for a variety of subsystem test stands
  • Develop database and post processing software to support system troubleshooting, development and analysis
  • Be able and willing to build or adapt new software development environments as needed.
  • Create graphical user interfaces for real time system telemetry and control panels
  • Maintain high quality documentation of code base and architectures
  • Help build our software engineering team as we grow

Requirements
  • Demonstrated self-starter / learning related to software and firmware
  • Experience with relevant computer programming languages such as C/C++, Python
  • Hands-on experience coding and testing prototype systems
  • Ability to plan projects and be accountable for deliverables & schedules
  • Proficiency in DO178C or ISO 26262 and applicable standard for Software Life Cycle
  • Proficiency in multi-application, multi-layer design , verification and implementation
  • Experience in Software in the loop and Hardware in the loop
  • Emphasis on real time high bandwidth control system theory, design, and implementation
  • Serial digital communication knowledge (UART, I2C, CAN, SPI)
  • Hands on experience with measurement and test equipment (oscilloscopes, DAQ's, etc)
  • Circuit design and PCB layout for mixed power/signal applications
  • Application/GUI programming
  • Experience with version control systems
  • Altium experience

Qualifications
  • Experience level: Experienced
  • Minimum 5 years of experience
  • Education: Bachelors (required)

Skills
  • Embedded Software Full Lifecycle

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.
